did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: James B. Coover Interviews with William Arnold Reeves, 1985-1992

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains 7 audio cassettes of interviews James B. Coover conducted with William Arnold Reeves at his workplace in London, England, 1985-1992.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], James B. Coover Interviews with William Arnold Reeves, 1985-1992, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of James and Jeanne Coover, 1992-1997.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

note.p: Two copies of each cassette have been retained until it can be determined which copy is the original and preferred for digitizing.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James Burrell Coover (1925-2004) was hired in 1967 by the State University of New York at Buffalo to become the first director of the Music Library. Previously he was the director of the George Sherman Dickinson Music Library at Vassar College 1953-1967 and Assistant Director of the Bibliographical Center for Research in Denver, Colorado 1950-1953. While at the University at Buffalo, Coover helped establish, with Carol June Bradley, a program in music librarianship that was responsible for training several generations of music librarians.

Coover's research resulted in several scholarly articles and the following books:
Music Lexicography Including a Study of Lacunae: 1500-1700 (1958)
Musical Instrument Collections: Catalogues and Cognate Literature (Detroit, 1981)
Music Publishing, Copyright, and Piracy in Victorian England (1985)
Antiquarians' Catalogues of Musical Interest (1988)
Private Music Collections: Catalogs and Cognate Literature (2001)

William Arnold Reeves (born 1916) was the fifth and last known William Reeves to operate the firm, William Reeves, Bookseller, Ltd. in London. He was the author of a text about Malaysian postal stamps, Federated Malay States : the printing history of its stamps and postal stationery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 7 audio cassettes of interviews James B. Coover conducted with William Arnold Reeves at his workplace in London, England, 1985-1992. The interviews in this collection provided much of the information in Coover's article, " William Reeves, Booksellers/Publishers, 1825- ", published in the 1994 festschrift, Music Publishing and Collecting: Essays in Honor of Donald W. Krummel, edited by David Hunter.
